<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: Java cipherinputstream turns all input data to 0: :I am writing an implementation of an algorithm for public and private key encryption using an RSA cipher and an AES cipher. In this method, the AES key is supposed to be deciphered by using an RSA CipherInputStream.public void loadKey(File in, byte[] privateKey) throws GeneralSecurityException, IOException {    PKCS8EncodedKeySpec privateKeySpec = new PKCS8EncodedKeySpec(privateKey);    KeyFactory kf = KeyFactory.getInstance("RSA");    PrivateKey pk = kf.generatePrivate(privateKeySpec);    rsacipher.init(Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, pk);    aesKey = new byte[128/8];    FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(in);    CipherInputStream input = new CipherInputStream(fis, rsacipher);    input.read(aesKey);    aesKeySpec = new SecretKeySpec(aesKey, "AES");    input.close();    fis.close(); } the FileInputStream gives me the encoded key (it is not the problem) but when passed through the CipherInputStream, the data becomes all zeroes. aesKey and aesKeySpec are static variables, privateKey is a valid RSA key.Any help in finding the problem would be much appreciated!
Please using this api: Cipher.init.
Answer:
response:

Question: Java cipherinputstream turns all input data to 0: :I am writing an implementation of an algorithm for public and private key encryption using an RSA cipher and an AES cipher. In this method, the AES key is supposed to be deciphered by using an RSA CipherInputStream.public void loadKey(File in, byte[] privateKey) throws GeneralSecurityException, IOException {    PKCS8EncodedKeySpec privateKeySpec = new PKCS8EncodedKeySpec(privateKey);    KeyFactory kf = KeyFactory.getInstance("RSA");    PrivateKey pk = kf.generatePrivate(privateKeySpec);    rsacipher.init(Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, pk);    aesKey = new byte[128/8];    FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(in);    CipherInputStream input = new CipherInputStream(fis, rsacipher);    input.read(aesKey);    aesKeySpec = new SecretKeySpec(aesKey, "AES");    input.close();    fis.close(); } the FileInputStream gives me the encoded key (it is not the problem) but when passed through the CipherInputStream, the data becomes all zeroes. aesKey and aesKeySpec are static variables, privateKey is a valid RSA key.Any help in finding the problem would be much appreciated!
Please using this api: Cipher.init.
Answer: The problem is that you are not using the CipherInputStream correctly. The CipherInputStream reads the data from the input stream and applies the cipher to it. Therefore, you should not call the read() method on the CipherInputStream, but instead call it on the FileInputStream. Here is the corrected code:

```java
public void loadKey(File in, byte[] privateKey) throws GeneralSecurityException, IOException {
    PKCS8EncodedKeySpec privateKeySpec = new PKCS8EncodedKeySpec(privateKey);
    KeyFactory kf = KeyFactory.getInstance("RSA");
    PrivateKey pk = kf.generatePrivate(privateKeySpec);
    rsacipher.init(Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, pk);
    aesKey = new byte[128/8];
    FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(in);
    CipherInputStream input = new CipherInputStream(fis, rsacipher);
    fis.read(aesKey); // read the decrypted data into aesKey
    aesKeySpec = new SecretKeySpec(aesKey, "AES");
    input.close();
    fis.close();
}
```

In this corrected code, the read() method is called on the FileInputStream fis, which reads the decrypted data into the aesKey variable. This way, the aesKey variable will contain the decrypted AES key.

Please note that the CipherInputStream does not provide a read() method. Instead, you should call the read() method on the underlying input stream (in this case, the FileInputStream).

I hope this helps you solve your problem. If you have any other questions, feel free to ask.
